page.title: 07Lyston
page.content: One of the windows in the Norman church at{Lyston}has medieval glass in the tracery with Our Lady holding orb and lily{(lys)}so we do not approve of the modern spelling Liston. Opposite the church is a row of four little cottages. Westwards is the lodge at the gates of the Hall which has all been pulled down except for wings making 2 residual houses and a small-holding. To the east are two houses and the mill, timber-framed and weather-boarded, now a residence. On the road to Borley there are three large houses and a small pair semidet. About 1km upstream is another little settlement called Liston Gardens, just scattered pairs of houses near the Bush Boake Allen{Factory. That's all there is of Lyston! Population 62.
